00023 void TimerManager::createTimer(const string& name, const bool& manualUpdate)
00024 {
00025     if (timers.find(name) == timers.end())
00026         timers[name] = new Timer(manualUpdate);
00027     else
00028         Utils::get()->writeToLog("Timer with name " + name + " already exists, ignoring.");
00029 }
00030 
00031 void TimerManager::startTimer(const string& name)
00032 {
00033     if (timers.find(name) != timers.end())
00034         timers[name]->start();
00035 }
00036 
00037 void TimerManager::pauseTimer(const string& name)
00038 {
00039     if (timers.find(name) != timers.end())
00040         timers[name]->pause();
00041 }
00042 
00043 void TimerManager::resumeTimer(const string& name)
00044 {
00045     if (timers.find(name) != timers.end())
00046         timers[name]->resume();
00047 }
00048 
00049 void TimerManager::stopTimer(const string& name)
00050 {
00051     if (timers.find(name) != timers.end())
00052         timers[name]->stop();
00053 }

00055 const double TimerManager::getTimerTime(const string& name)
00056 {
00057     if (timers.find(name) != timers.end())
00058         return timers[name]->getTime();
00059     else
00060         return 0;
00061 }
00062 
00063 void TimerManager::addTimerTime(const string& name, const double& time)
00064 {
00065     if (timers.find(name) != timers.end())
00066         timers[name]->update(time);
00067 }
00068 
00069 void TimerManager::pauseAllTimers()
00070 {
00071     map<string, Timer*>::const_iterator iter;
00072     for (iter = timers.begin(); iter != timers.end(); ++iter)
00073         iter->second->pause();
00074 }
00075 
00076 void TimerManager::resumeAllTimers()
00077 {
00078     map<string, Timer*>::const_iterator iter;
00079     for (iter = timers.begin(); iter != timers.end(); ++iter)
00080         iter->second->resume();
00081 }
00082 
00083 void TimerManager::destroyTimer(const string& name)
00084 {
00085     if (timers.find(name) != timers.end())
00086     {
00087         delete timers[name];
00088         timers.erase(name);
00089     }
00090     else
00091         Utils::get()->writeToLog("Timer with name " + name + " does not exist, ignoring.");
00092 }
00093 
00094 void TimerManager::clearTimers()
00095 {
00096     map<string, Timer*>::iterator iter;
00097     for (iter = timers.begin(); iter != timers.end(); ++iter)
00098     {
00099         Timer* tmp = iter->second;
00100         delete tmp;
00101     }
00102     timers.clear();
00103 }
00104 
00105 const double TimerManager::getTimeFactor()
00106 {
00107     return timeFactor;
00108 }
00109 
00110 void TimerManager::setTimeFactor(const double& factor)
00111 {
00112     if (factor > 0)
00113         timeFactor = factor;
00114 }
00115 
00116 void TimerManager::update()
00117 {
00118     map<string, Timer*>::const_iterator iter;
00119     for (iter = timers.begin(); iter != timers.end(); ++iter)
00120     {
00121         if (!iter->second->isManuallyUpdated())
00122             iter->second->update(Utils::get()->getDTime() * timeFactor);
00123     }
00124 }
00125 
00126 TimerManager* TimerManager::get()
00127 {
00128     if (manager == NULL)
00129         manager = new TimerManager();
00130 
00131     return manager;
00132 }
